subjectPrefix.description: A prefix to add to all email subjects to aid in identifying automated emails

startTlsEnabled.description: Enable STARTTLS Support for Insecure Connections

sslServerIdentityCheckEnabled.description: Verify the server certificate when using TLS or SSL

nexusTrustStoreEnabled.description: Use the Nexus Repository Manager's certificate truststore

name.description: A unique identifier for this repository

format.description: Component format held in this repository

type.description: Controls if deployments of and updates to artifacts are allowed

online.description: Whether this repository accepts incoming requests

name.description: The content selector name cannot be changed after creation

type.description: The type of content selector the backend is using

expression.description: The expression used to identify content

name.description: The content selector name cannot be changed after creation

expression.description: The expression used to identify content

description.description: An optional description of this content selector

expression.description: The expression used to identify content

mode.description: Determines what should be done with requests when their path matches any of the matchers

matchers.description: Regular expressions used to identify request paths that are allowed or blocked (depending on mode)

name.description: The name of the privilege.  This value cannot be changed.

actions.description: A collection of actions to associate with the privilege, using BREAD syntax (browse,read,edit,add,delete,all) as well as 'run' for script privileges.

format.description: The repository format (i.e 'nuget', 'npm') this privilege will grant access to (or * for all).

repository.description: The name of the repository this privilege will grant access to (or * for all).

name.description: The name of the privilege.  This value cannot be changed.

actions.description: A collection of actions to associate with the privilege, using BREAD syntax (browse,read,edit,add,delete,all) as well as 'run' for script privileges.

format.description: The repository format (i.e 'nuget', 'npm') this privilege will grant access to (or * for all).

repository.description: The name of the repository this privilege will grant access to (or * for all).

name.description: The name of the privilege.  This value cannot be changed.

actions.description: A collection of actions to associate with the privilege, using BREAD syntax (browse,read,edit,add,delete,all) as well as 'run' for script privileges.

format.description: The repository format (i.e 'nuget', 'npm') this privilege will grant access to (or * for all).

repository.description: The name of the repository this privilege will grant access to (or * for all).

contentSelector.description: The name of a content selector that will be used to grant access to content via this privilege.

enabled.description: Whether or not Anonymous Access is enabled

userId.description: The username of the anonymous account

realmName.description: The name of the authentication realm for the anonymous account

userId.description: The userid which is required for login. This value cannot be changed.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

emailAddress.description: The email address associated with the user.

source.description: The user source which is the origin of this user. This value cannot be changed.

status.description: The user's status, e.g. active or disabled.

readOnly.description: Indicates whether the user's properties could be modified by the Nexus Repository Manager. When false only roles are considered during update.

roles.description: The roles which the user has been assigned within Nexus.

externalRoles.description: The roles which the user has been assigned in an external source, e.g. LDAP group. These cannot be changed within the Nexus Repository Manager.

userId.description: The userid which is required for login. This value cannot be changed.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

emailAddress.description: The email address associated with the user.

password.description: The password for the new user.

status.description: The user's status, e.g. active or disabled.

roles.description: The roles which the user has been assigned within Nexus.

type.description: The type of privilege, each type covers different portions of the system. External values supplied to this will be ignored by the system.

name.description: The name of the privilege.  This value cannot be changed.

readOnly.description: Indicates whether the privilege can be changed. External values supplied to this will be ignored by the system.

name.description: The name of the privilege.  This value cannot be changed.

actions.description: A collection of actions to associate with the privilege, using BREAD syntax (browse,read,edit,add,delete,all) as well as 'run' for script privileges.

domain.description: The domain (i.e. 'blobstores', 'capabilities' or even '*' for all) that this privilege is granting access to.  Note that creating new privileges with a domain is only necessary when using plugins that define their own domain(s).

name.description: The name of the privilege.  This value cannot be changed.

pattern.description: A colon separated list of parts that create a permission string.

name.description: The name of the role.

privileges.description: The list of privileges assigned to this role.

roles.description: The list of roles assigned to this role.

source.description: The user source which is the origin of this role.

name.description: The name of the role.

readOnly.description: Indicates whether the role can be changed. The system will ignore any supplied external values.

privileges.description: The list of privileges assigned to this role.

roles.description: The list of roles assigned to this role.

endpoint.description: A custom endpoint URL for third party object stores using the S3 API.

signerType.description: An API signature version which may be required for third party object stores using the S3 API.

forcePathStyle.description: Setting this flag will result in path-style access being used for all requests.

maxConnectionPoolSize.description: Setting this value will override the default connection pool size of Nexus of the s3 client for this blobstore.

region.description: The AWS region to create a new S3 bucket in or an existing S3 bucket's region

name.description: The name of the S3 bucket

prefix.description: The S3 blob store (i.e S3 object) key prefix

expiration.description: How many days until deleted blobs are finally removed from the S3 bucket (-1 to disable)

bucket.description: Details of the S3 bucket such as name and region

encryption.description: The type of encryption to use if any

failoverBuckets.description: A list of secondary buckets which have bidirectional replication enabled and should be used when Nexus is running in the region

activeRegion.description: The active region based on bucket configuration, failover buckets, and EC2 region Nexus is running.

preSignedUrlEnabled.description: Whether pre assigned URL is enabled or not.

bucketSecurity.description: Security details for granting access the S3 API

advancedBucketConnection.description: A custom endpoint URL, signer type and whether path style access is enabled

accessKeyId.description: An IAM access key ID for granting access to the S3 bucket

secretAccessKey.description: The secret access key associated with the specified IAM access key ID

role.description: An IAM role to assume in order to access the S3 bucket

sessionToken.description: An AWS STS session token associated with temporary security credentials which grant access to the S3 bucket

encryptionType.description: The type of S3 server side encryption to use.

bucketName.description: The name of the bucket in the region

name.description: The name of the S3 blob store.

softQuota.description: Settings to control the soft quota.

bucketConfiguration.description: The S3 specific configuration details for the S3 object that'll contain the blob store.

name.description: A unique identifier for this repository

online.description: Whether this repository accepts incoming requests

keypair.description: PGP signing key pair (armored private key e.g. gpg --export-secret-key --armor)

passphrase.description: Passphrase to access PGP signing key

policyNames.description: Components that match any of the applied policies will be deleted

proprietaryComponents.description: Components in this repository count as proprietary for namespace conflict attacks (requires Sonatype Nexus Firewall)

blobStoreName.description: Blob store used to store repository contents

strictContentTypeValidation.description: Whether to validate uploaded content's MIME type appropriate for the repository format

writePolicy.description: Controls if deployments of and updates to assets are allowed

name.description: A unique identifier for this repository

online.description: Whether this repository accepts incoming requests

name.description: A unique identifier for this repository

online.description: Whether this repository accepts incoming requests

blocked.description: Whether to block outbound connections on the repository

autoBlock.description: Whether to auto-block outbound connections if remote peer is detected as unreachable/unresponsive

retries.description: Total retries if the initial connection attempt suffers a timeout

userAgentSuffix.description: Custom fragment to append to User-Agent header in HTTP requests

timeout.description: Seconds to wait for activity before stopping and retrying the connection

enableCircularRedirects.description: Whether to enable redirects to the same location (may be required by some servers)

enableCookies.description: Whether to allow cookies to be stored and used

useTrustStore.description: Use certificates stored in the Nexus Repository Manager truststore to connect to external systems

enabled.description: Whether to cache responses for content not present in the proxied repository

timeToLive.description: How long to cache the fact that a file was not found in the repository (in minutes)

remoteUrl.description: Location of the remote repository being proxied

contentMaxAge.description: How long to cache artifacts before rechecking the remote repository (in minutes)

metadataMaxAge.description: How long to cache metadata before rechecking the remote repository (in minutes)

assetPathRegex.description: Regular Expression of Asset Paths to pull pre-emptively pull

blobStoreName.description: Blob store used to store repository contents

strictContentTypeValidation.description: Whether to validate uploaded content's MIME type appropriate for the repository format

name.description: A unique identifier for this repository

online.description: Whether this repository accepts incoming requests

routingRuleName.description: The name of the routing rule assigned to this repository

versionPolicy.description: What type of artifacts does this repository store?

layoutPolicy.description: Validate that all paths are maven artifact or metadata paths

blocked.description: Whether to block outbound connections on the repository

autoBlock.description: Whether to auto-block outbound connections if remote peer is detected as unreachable/unresponsive

preemptive.description: Whether to use pre-emptive authentication. Use with caution. Defaults to false.

routingRuleName.description: The name of the routing rule assigned to this repository

name.description: The name of the privilege.  This value cannot be changed.

actions.description: A collection of actions to associate with the privilege, using BREAD syntax (browse,read,edit,add,delete,all) as well as 'run' for script privileges.

scriptName.description: The name of a script to give access to.

authenticationMethod.description: The type of Azure authentication to use.

accountName.description: Account name found under Access keys for the storage account.

containerName.description: The name of an existing container to be used for storage.

name.description: The name of the Azure blob store.

softQuota.description: Settings to control the soft quota.

bucketConfiguration.description: The Azure specific configuration details for the Azure object that'll contain the blob store.

name.description: The name of the GC Storage bucket

region.description: The GCP region to create a new GC Storage bucket in or an existing GC Storage bucket's region. Should be the same as Nexus deployment region.

prefix.description: The GC Storage blob store (i.e GC Storage object) key prefix

authenticationMethod.description: The type of Google Cloud authentication to use.

bucket.description: Details of the GC Storage bucket such as name and region

encryption.description: The type of encryption to use

bucketSecurity.description: Security details for granting access the GC Storage API

encryptionType.description: The type of GCP server side encryption to use.

name.description: The name of the GC Storage blob store.

softQuota.description: Settings to control the soft quota.

bucketConfiguration.description: The GC Storage specific configuration details for the GC Storage object that'll contain the blob store.

softQuota.description: Settings to control the soft quota

members.description: List of the names of blob stores that are members of this group

softQuota.description: Settings to control the soft quota

members.description: List of the names of blob stores that are members of this group

softQuota.description: Settings to control the soft quota

members.description: List of the names of blob stores that are members of this group

softQuota.description: Settings to control the soft quota

members.description: List of the names of blob stores that are members of this group

enabled.description: Whether to use Sonatype Repository Firewall

showLink.description: Show Sonatype Repository Firewall link in Browse menu when server is enabled

url.description: The address of your Sonatype Repository Firewall

username.description: User with access to Sonatype Repository Firewall

password.description: Credentials for the Sonatype Repository Firewall User

useTrustStoreForUrl.description: Use certificates stored in the Nexus Repository Manager truststore to connect to Sonatype Repository Firewall

timeoutSeconds.description: Seconds to wait for activity before stopping and retrying the connection. Leave blank to use the globally defined HTTP timeout.

properties.description: Additional properties to configure for Sonatype Repository Firewall

failOpenModeEnabled.description: Allow by default when quarantine is enabled and the IQ connection fails

name.description: LDAP server name

protocol.description: LDAP server connection Protocol to use

useTrustStore.description: Whether to use certificates stored in Nexus Repository Manager's truststore

port.description: LDAP server connection port to use

searchBase.description: LDAP location to be added to the connection URL

authScheme.description: Authentication scheme used for connecting to LDAP server

authRealm.description: The SASL realm to bind to. Required if authScheme is CRAM_MD5 or DIGEST_MD5

authUsername.description: This must be a fully qualified username if simple authentication is used. Required if authScheme other than none.

connectionTimeoutSeconds.description: How long to wait before timeout

connectionRetryDelaySeconds.description: How long to wait before retrying

userBaseDn.description: The relative DN where user objects are found (e.g. ou=people). This value will have the Search base DN value appended to form the full User search base DN.

userSubtree.description: Are users located in structures below the user base DN?

userLdapFilter.description: LDAP search filter to limit user search

userIdAttribute.description: This is used to find a user given its user ID

userRealNameAttribute.description: This is used to find a real name given the user ID

userEmailAddressAttribute.description: This is used to find an email address given the user ID

userPasswordAttribute.description: If this field is blank the user will be authenticated against a bind with the LDAP server

ldapGroupsAsRoles.description: Denotes whether LDAP assigned roles are used as Nexus Repository Manager roles

groupType.description: Defines a type of groups used: static (a group contains a list of users) or dynamic (a user contains a list of groups). Required if ldapGroupsAsRoles is true.

groupBaseDn.description: The relative DN where group objects are found (e.g. ou=Group). This value will have the Search base DN value appended to form the full Group search base DN.

groupSubtree.description: Are groups located in structures below the group base DN

groupObjectClass.description: LDAP class for group objects. Required if groupType is static

groupIdAttribute.description: This field specifies the attribute of the Object class that defines the Group ID. Required if groupType is static

groupMemberAttribute.description: LDAP attribute containing the usernames for the group. Required if groupType is static

groupMemberFormat.description: The format of user ID stored in the group member attribute. Required if groupType is static

userMemberOfAttribute.description: Set this to the attribute used to store the attribute which holds groups DN in the user object. Required if groupType is dynamic

order.description: Order number in which the server is being used when looking for a user
